3: I know we're supposed to decorate the venue, but we really can't be wasting resources, so we can only do something simple.
I think this is more than good enough!
As long as you guys are happy.
Don't mention it. We wanted to do it ourselves.
Everyone's almost here. Let's begin the ceremony, Lee.
Sure. We're only playing the second part of the recording anyway.
We'll start playing at this timestamp...
Thank you, whoever you are in the future.
Is it starting?
Commandant, it's about to start!

4: I don't think I do very well in this kind of function.

3: (Nods)
I'm a little nervous too... but we'll be fine if we stick together!
Before our wedding begins, the two of us have something we want to tell you.
Although you might have guessed it already, we still want to tell you, you generous soul... I'm afraid we've long passed at this point.
After the virus broke out, neither of us could board Babylonia, nor did we have the strength to run away.
But even as the world became more and more unfamiliar, we were still holding each other's hand, bathing in this overwhelming love.
We're leaving this recording behind in this church, not because we want to have a wedding or have you host a celebration for us...
We just hope someone will know that we love each other very much.
I love you, Julie.
I love you too, Edward.
If you ever fall in love the way we do, you from the future... we'll be praying for you.
Commandant, I think... I really like my new frame.
